Pakistani embassy officials help farmers
articles.content:
Pakistani embassy officials help farmers
    Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Fazal Ghafoor, Pakistani  ambassador to Korea, and embassy officials visited Korea-Pakistan Friendship Taesong Co-op Farm in Pyongyang on Wednesday to help it in farming.
   The guests transplanted rice seedlings with farmers. At a break they sang Korean and Pakistani songs and talked with farmers.

articles.title: Friendly meeting with Iranian embassy officials
articles.content:
Friendly meeting with Iranian embassy officials
   Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with Iranian embassy officials was held at the Korea-Iran Friendship  Sosong Senior Middle School no.1 in Pyongyang   on Wednesday on the occasion of a week of Korea-Iran friendship.
   Present there were vice-chairman Ri Song Ho of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and teaching staff and students of the school.   Mohammad Ganjidoost, Iranian ambassador to Korea, and embassy officials were invited.   The participants looked round educational facilities of the school before appreciating an art performance given by students.

articles.title: S. Korean crewmen arrested
articles.content:
S. Korean crewmen arrested
    Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Two crewmen of the  South Korean ship Sindaejin enrolled at the Ryangpho port in Kyongju, North Kyongsang Province, attempted to come over to the North Korea on May 23, a Seoul-based radio reported.
They were sailing  northward for ten hours from the sea 130 miles east of the Taebo port, Phohang city.
   The South Korean police arrested them by invoking an evil law.
